intro: Collaea neesii var. floribunda, commonly known as the showy collaea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and birds. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
